pageProps.content:
Experience

Set in an ancient acacia forest close to the rim of the magnificent Ngorongoro Crater, Lemala Ngorongoro Tented Camp offers an intimate & secluded safari experience.
With easy access to the crater floor, Lemala guests usually have an hour’s head start over others descending the far busier road on the western rim. This ideal location allows guests early access to the crater – crucial for photographers who demand the best light conditions.
Excellent year-round wildlife viewing can be expected as the Ngorongoro Crater is one of the best Big 5 reserves in East Africa.

Stay

Small & intimate, there are only 9 luxury tents at Lemala Ngorongoro Tented Camp, including 1 family tent that can sleep up to 5 people.
Each tent features an en-suite bathroom, wooden floors with cosy rugs & a small patio.
The mess tent hosts a communal lounge, dining area, bar & library.

Activities

Lemala Ngorongoro includes a list of thrilling safari activities.
These include open 4x4 game drives, sundowner excursions & bush lunches on the floor of the crater.
Guests can also go on tuk-tuk rides to nearby villages, visit the Maasai tribe or send their children to the Kids Club for some African-inspired fun-filled activities.

subfolders.title: Entamanu Ngorongoro Camp
subfolders.description: Entamanu Ngorongoro boasts a secluded setting at the edge of the crater’s rim at roughly 3,000 feet above sea level. Tanzania’s Ngorongoro Crater is the country’s most famous landmark & the largest intact volcanic caldera in the world.  And in 2015 it was officially hailed as one of the Seven Natural Wonders of Africa.

subfolders.title: Entamanu Private Camp
subfolders.description: Entamanu Private Camp offers an unmatched, exclusive safari experience at the edge of the crater’s rim at roughly 3,000 feet above sea level. Tanzania’s Ngorongoro Crater is the country’s most famous landmark & the largest intact volcanic caldera in the world.  And in 2015 it was officially hailed as one of the Seven Natural Wonders of Africa.

subfolders.title: Gibb's Farm
subfolders.description: Gibb’s Farm is set on a working farm against the slopes of Tanzania’s Ngorongoro Conservation Area, close to the world’s largest inactive, unbroken & unfilled volcanic caldera: the Ngorongoro Crater. Here guests can experience farm life at its best! With garden-to-table meals & interactive farm affairs like milking the cows, feeding the pigs or joining the farm’s coffee roasters to experience traditional coffee roasting methods – Gibb’s Farm has it all.

subfolders.title: Kitela Lodge
subfolders.description: Kitela Lodge is set on a hillside in the highlands of the Ngorongoro Crater Area & offers breathtaking views of a coffee plantation & waterfall. Surrounded by majestic mountains, this exclusive retreat is an ideal base from which to explore the region, including the nearby Ngorongoro Crater.

subfolders.title: Lemala Ndutu
subfolders.description: Lemala Ndutu is a mobile tented camp that is set up between November & April each year – during the best wildlife season - & has been described as having the ‘ultimate front row’ seats to the Great Migration. Each year millions of wildebeest, zebra & gazelle migrate in a clockwise direction across the ecosystems of the Serengeti in Tanzania & the Masai Mara in Kenya.

subfolders.title: Lemala Ngorongoro
subfolders.description: Set in an ancient acacia forest close to the rim of the magnificent Ngorongoro Crater, Lemala Ngorongoro Tented Camp offers an intimate & secluded safari experience. With easy access to the crater floor, Lemala guests usually have an hour’s head start over others descending the far busier road on the western rim.  This ideal location allows guests early access to the crater – crucial for photographers who demand the best light conditions.

subfolders.title: Neptune Ngorongoro Luxury Lodge
subfolders.description: Neptune Ngorongoro Luxury Lodge is situated on the edge of the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, a short drive from the game-rich Ngorongoro Crater as well as the rewarding Lake Manyara National Park – famed for its tree-climbing lions. Overlooking a dramatic landscape of volcanic peaks & coffee plantations, Neptune Ngorongoro Luxury Lodge is a tranquil haven for safari-goers in search of superb wildlife viewing & interesting day excursions.

subfolders.title: Ngorongoro Crater Lodge
subfolders.description: Ngorongoro Crater Lodge boasts an amazing location on the rim of the world’s largest intact & unflooded caldera – the iconic Ngorongoro Crater. Offering magnificent views over the game-rich crater, the lodge boasts stunning architecture resembling a traditional Maasai mud-&-stick homestead while the interiors & finishes are pure opulence.

subfolders.title: Ngorongoro Farm House
subfolders.description: Set on a 500-acre coffee farm with glorious views of Oldeani Volcano, Ngorongoro Farm House enjoys an ideal location just 4km from the entrance to the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, close to Lake Eyasi. Ngorongoro Farm House has been designed to reflect an old colonial farm with rustic local materials & Victorian bathtubs.

subfolders.title: Ngorongoro Serena Safari Lodge
subfolders.description: Ngorongoro Serena Safari Lodge enjoys a spectacular location on the edge of the world’s largest intact & unflooded caldera – the famous Ngorongoro Crater in Tanzania. Inspired by cave paintings of Olduvai Gorge, the décor & interiors resemble Africa in every way.  Even the lodge exterior is built from natural stone, giving it a cave-like appearance.

subfolders.title: Ngorongoro Sopa Lodge
subfolders.description: Perched on the edge of the Ngorongoro Crater’s highest point, the superb Ngorongoro Sopa Lodge is the only property on the eastern rim of this UNESCO World Heritage Site. The world’s largest intact & unflooded caldera provides a home to a multitude of wildlife, including Africa’s Big 5 – lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo & rhino.

subfolders.title: Sanctuary Ngorongoro Crater Camp
subfolders.description: Sanctuary Ngorongoro Crater Camp is set within the rim valley of the iconic Ngorongoro Crater -   the world’s largest intact & unflooded caldera & a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

subfolders.title: The Highlands Ngorongoro
subfolders.description: The Highlands, an award-winning tented camp, boasts a spectacular setting on the forested slopes of the extinct Olmoti Volcano, surrounded by the Ngorongoro Conservation Area. Offering awe-inspiring views, stylish tents with high-tech facilities & exquisite attention to detail, The Highlands Ngorongoro is quite simply the perfect place from which to discover the wild & pristine Crater Highlands.

subfolders.title: The Manor at Ngorongoro
subfolders.description: The Manor at Ngorongoro, a Cape Dutch style farmhouse, lies within the Shangri-La Arabica Coffee Estate, adjacent to the Ngorongoro Conservation Area in Tanzania. This grand mansion exudes old-world charm & offers guests an exclusive safari experience combining East African hospitality & timeless architecture.

whatWeLoveItems: Quiet setting near the Ngorongoro Crater floor
Fantastic year-round crater floor game viewing
One of East Africa’s best Big 5 reserves
Walking safaris with a Maasai guide
